definitions: having parts that fail to correspond to one another in shape, size, or arrangement
examples: The asymmetric design created visual interest in the building
Her asymmetric haircut was fashionably edgy

definitions: lacking symmetry or having unequal or unbalanced proportions on opposite sides
examples: The asymmetrical hem gave the dress a modern look
Asymmetrical compositions can create dynamic visual tension

definitions: producing or showing no symptoms despite infection or disease being present
examples: Many asymptomatic patients unknowingly spread the virus
The asymptomatic stage can last for several years

definitions: not occurring at the same time; operating independently of timing or coordination
examples: Asynchronous learning allows students to study at their own pace
The asynchronous communication system prevented data conflicts

definitions: relating to or characterized by disbelief in the existence of God or gods
examples: His atheist worldview shaped his philosophical writings
The atheist community organized secular charity events

definitions: characterized by or showing rejection of belief in the existence of deities
examples: The atheistic philosophy challenged traditional religious thought
His atheistic arguments were carefully reasoned

definitions: physically strong, fit, and active with good muscle development
relating to or characteristic of athletes or athletics
examples: Her athletic build helped her excel at multiple sports
The athletic teenager won three track events
The school's athletic program produced several Olympic athletes
Athletic scholarships helped many students attend college

definitions: relating to the earth's atmosphere or the air around us
creating a distinctive emotional mood or aesthetic feeling
examples: Atmospheric pressure changes can affect weather patterns
The atmospheric conditions were perfect for stargazing
The atmospheric music enhanced the film's emotional impact
The restaurant's atmospheric lighting created intimacy

definitions: relating to atoms or consisting of atoms
extremely small; at the smallest possible level
relating to nuclear weapons or nuclear energy
examples: Atomic structure determines an element's chemical properties
Scientists studied atomic particles in the accelerator
The changes occurred at an atomic level
Atomic precision is required for this nanotechnology
The atomic age began with the Manhattan Project
Several nations possess atomic weapons

definitions: horrifyingly wicked, cruel, or brutal in nature
extremely bad or unpleasant; of very poor quality
examples: The atrocious war crimes shocked the international community
Their atrocious treatment of prisoners violated human rights
The food was absolutely atrocious at that restaurant
His atrocious handwriting was impossible to read

definitions: joined, fastened, or connected to something else
having strong emotional feelings or affection for someone or something
examples: The attached document contains important information
Keep the receipt attached to the warranty card
She became deeply attached to her foster family
He's too attached to material possessions

definitions: characterized by or involving aggressive action against an opponent or target
examples: The team's attacking strategy overwhelmed their opponents
His attacking style of chess often surprised competitors

definitions: able to be attained, reached, or accomplished; achievable
examples: Setting attainable goals helps maintain motivation
The summit was barely attainable in good weather

definitions: successfully achieved or reached after effort
examples: The attained level of excellence impressed everyone
His attained status came through years of hard work

definitions: tried or made an effort to do something, often unsuccessfully
examples: The attempted robbery was stopped by security guards
Her attempted explanation only confused matters more

definitions: occurring with or as a result of something else; accompanying
examples: The attendant risks of surgery worried the patient
Fame brings attendant responsibilities and pressures

definitions: having people present at an event or gathering
accompanied by someone providing care or supervision
examples: The well-attended conference exceeded expectations
It was the most attended event of the year
The attended delivery ensured safety for mother and baby
Attended parking means someone parks your car

definitions: being the physician or medical professional with primary responsibility
examples: The attending physician reviewed all test results
She's the attending doctor on this case

definitions: paying close attention to something; alert and watchful
assiduously attending to the comfort or wishes of others
examples: The attentive students took detailed notes during class
She remained attentive throughout the long presentation
The attentive waiter anticipated our every need
He was attentive to his elderly mother's needs

definitions: proved to be true or genuine; certified or authenticated
examples: The attested documents were accepted by the court
Her attested qualifications impressed the hiring committee

definitions: dressed in clothes of a specified kind, especially formal or elaborate
examples: The elegantly attired guests arrived at the gala
She was attired in traditional ceremonial robes

definitions: pleasing or appealing to the senses, especially visually beautiful
arousing interest or engaging; having beneficial features that encourage acceptance
examples: The attractive design won several architecture awards
She found him physically attractive
The company made an attractive offer to investors
The attractive salary package included many benefits

definitions: able to be attributed to a particular cause, source, or origin
examples: The success was attributable to careful planning
Most accidents are attributable to human error

definitions: not representative of a type, group, or class; unusual or uncommon
examples: His atypical symptoms made diagnosis difficult
It was an atypical response to the medication

definitions: having a reddish-brown color, especially describing hair
examples: Her auburn hair gleamed in the sunlight
The horse's auburn coat was perfectly groomed

definitions: showing a willingness to take surprisingly bold risks
showing an impudent lack of respect; insolently bold
examples: Her audacious business plan revolutionized the industry
The audacious rescue attempt succeeded against all odds
His audacious behavior at the formal dinner shocked everyone
The audacious student challenged the professor publicly

definitions: able to be heard clearly; loud enough to be perceived by the ear
examples: Her voice was barely audible over the noise
The alarm must be audible throughout the building

definitions: using both sight and sound, typically in electronic media or education
examples: The audiovisual presentation enhanced student learning
They installed new audiovisual equipment in the conference room

definitions: relating to the sense of hearing or the organs of hearing
examples: The auditory nerve carries signals from the ear to brain
Some people are auditory learners who learn best through listening

definitions: having been made greater in size, extent, or quantity; enhanced
examples: The augmented reality app overlays digital information
Her augmented income allowed more financial freedom

definitions: inspiring respect and admiration through dignity, importance, or grandeur
examples: The august assembly included Nobel Prize winners
She maintained an august presence despite her humble origins

definitions: relating to the ear or the sense of hearing
examples: The aural examination tested her hearing ability
Musicians need excellent aural skills

definitions: conducive to success; giving or being a sign of future success
examples: It was an auspicious beginning to their partnership
The auspicious weather blessed the wedding day

definitions: severe or strict in manner, attitude, or appearance; without comfort or luxury
having an extremely plain and simple style without decoration
examples: The monk led an austere life of prayer and fasting
His austere demeanor intimidated the students
The austere design reflected minimalist principles
Their austere living conditions shocked visitors

definitions: of undisputed origin; genuine and not a copy or fake
made or done in the traditional or original way; true to cultural origins
examples: The museum verified the painting was authentic
She wore an authentic Victorian dress to the ball
The restaurant serves authentic Italian cuisine
His authentic accent revealed his origins

definitions: proved or verified to be genuine through examination or evidence
examples: The authenticated documents were submitted to court
Only authenticated users can access the system

definitions: relating to or characteristic of an author or authorship
examples: The authorial voice was distinctive throughout the novel
Critics debated the authorial intent behind the symbolism

definitions: having official permission or approval; sanctioned
examples: Only authorised personnel may enter this area
The authorised biography revealed new details

definitions: favoring or enforcing strict obedience to authority at the expense of personal freedom
examples: The authoritarian regime suppressed all dissent
His authoritarian parenting style caused family tension

definitions: commanding and self-confident; likely to be respected and obeyed
able to be trusted as being accurate or true; reliable
examples: Her authoritative manner commanded immediate attention
He spoke in an authoritative tone
This is the most authoritative book on the subject
The authoritative source confirmed the information

definitions: having official permission or approval to do something
examples: The authorized dealer can service your warranty
Only authorized personnel should handle these materials

definitions: relating to or affected by autism, a developmental disorder affecting communication and behavior
examples: The autistic child excelled in mathematics
Autistic individuals often have unique strengths and perspectives

definitions: dealing with or about one's own life story and experiences
examples: Her autobiographical novel drew from childhood experiences
The film contained autobiographical elements from the director

definitions: relating to a ruler who has absolute power; domineering and dictatorial
examples: The autocratic leader made all decisions unilaterally
His autocratic management style demoralized employees

definitions: bearing the signature of a famous or notable person
examples: The autographed baseball was his prized possession
She collected autographed first editions

definitions: relating to disease caused by antibodies or lymphocytes attacking the body's own tissues
examples: Lupus is an autoimmune disease affecting multiple organs
The autoimmune response damaged healthy cells

definitions: operated by largely automatic equipment and requiring minimal human intervention
examples: The automated factory produces thousands of units daily
Automated systems handle most banking transactions

definitions: working by itself with little or no direct human control
done or occurring spontaneously without conscious thought or intention
examples: The automatic doors opened as she approached
The car has automatic transmission
Her response was automatic after years of training
Breathing is an automatic bodily function

definitions: relating to motor vehicles, especially cars and their manufacture
examples: The automotive industry employs millions worldwide
He studied automotive engineering at university

definitions: having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs
acting independently or having the freedom to do so
examples: The autonomous region has its own parliament
Several universities gained autonomous status
The autonomous vehicle navigated without human input
She valued her autonomous decision-making ability
